Npc.Terraria/Guide: Human trained in knowledge of manufacturing and exploration. Can instruct you on various forms of crafting.
Npc.Terraria/Merchant: Human who exchanges basic goods in exchange for currency.
Npc.Terraria/Nurse: Human with medical knowledge that can administer medication in exchange for currency.
Npc.Terraria/Dryad: Human with an affinity for nature. Will exchange natural goods for currency.
Npc.Terraria/Demolitionist: Human who will exchange explosives for currency.
Npc.Terraria/ArmsDealer: Human who will exchange firearms and ammunition for currency.
Npc.Terraria/DyeTrader: Human who will exchange pigments for currency.
Npc.Terraria/Angler: Adolescent human known to request strange marine life.
Npc.Terraria/Zoologist: Human-animal hybrid who will exchange animal-related goods for currency.
Npc.Terraria/Painter: Human who will exchange paint and artwork for currency.
Npc.Terraria/Golfer: Human who will exchange recreational equipment for currency
Npc.Terraria/Tavernkeep: Human of unknown origin. Will exchange artifacts from their point of origin for strange currency.
Npc.Terraria/Stylist: Human who will exchange hair products and services for currency.
Npc.Terraria/GoblinTinkerer: Goblin who will exchange mechanical devices and forging services for currency. Exceptionally wealthy.
Npc.Terraria/WitchDoctor: Lizard who will exchange magical artifacts for currency.
Npc.Terraria/Clothier: Human who will exchange clothing items for currency. Previously cursed.
Npc.Terraria/Mechanic: Human who will exchange mechanical components for currency.
Npc.Terraria/PartyGirl: Human who will exchange colorful items for currency.
Npc.Terraria/Slime: Creature made of living gelatine. Some contain valuable metals and potions. Gelatine is highly flammable.
Npc.Terraria/Zombie: Risen human driven by a hunger for flesh. Rarely carries defensive shackles.
Npc.Terraria/DemonEye: Sentient eyeball with contact lens. Smaller specimen of it's species.
Npc.Terraria/Skeleton: Animated human skeleton. Rarely carries hooks used in mining operations.
Npc.Terraria/Crimera: Flesh creature with an appetite for blood. Has a notibly large spine.
Npc.Terraria/FaceMonster: Flesh creature with an elongated head. Has a notibly large spine.
Npc.Terraria/EyeOfCthulhu: Largest specimen of a race of sentient eyeballs. Contains a large jaw beneath it's cornea, and posses the ability to move swiftly in short bursts.
Npc.Terraria/KingSlime: Large amalgamation of sentient gelatine. Will break apart into individual creatures when struck.
Npc.StarlightRiver/SquidBoss: A large aquatic beast protected by the energy in it's tentacles. These tentacles turn red when vulnerable to physical attack.
Npc.StarlightRiver/BossRushOrb: The composition of this sphere is unkown.
Npc.StarlightRiver/CrscentCaster: This creature uses lightning magic to form protective barriers around it's allies.
Npc.StarlightRiver/Crow: Corvid scholar with knowledge that should not be known.
Npc.StarlightRiver/Dreambeast: Hallucinatory creature manifested to physical form by nearby metallic stone. Avoid further contact.
Npc.StarlightRiver/Dweller: Creature made of decayed flesh, commonly uses foliage to disguise itself as a tree. Hunts prey by falling on then devouring them.
Npc.StarlightRiver/FogBinder: Ghostly creature which captures nearby creatures with ghastly chains to protect itself. Cannot sustain itself in the presence of physical contact.
Npc.StarlightRiver/Glassweaver: Survivor of an ancient race of glassblowers. Capable of conjuring deadly glass creatures and weapons at will. Stay off the ground.
Npc.StarlightRiver/GlassweaverWaiting: Survivor of an ancient race of glassblowers.
Npc.StarlightRiver/TentacleHurtbox: The flesh of this tentacle is impenetrable -- only the energy is subject to physical damage when glowing red.
Npc.StarlightRiver/VitricBoss: Construct built to protect it's temple, made of ceramic and glass. Can vent it's molten core into deadly attacks.
Npc.StarlightRiver/Snoobel: Obscure hybrid creature with little aesthetic appeal. Uses it's unnaturally large trunk as a weapon.
Npc.StarlightRiver/Stalker: A harmless hallucination induced by corrupt spores.
Npc.StarlightRiver/Warbanner: Possesed banner emitting enraging energy to nearby creatures, empowering them.
Npc.StarlightRiver/TheThinker: Pure thought made sentient. It's cocoon may be ruptured using a material known as 'Dendrite'.

Tile.Terraria/Stone: Solid rock, suitable for construction of a furnace.
Tile.Terraria/Wood: Processed wood suitible for structural purposes and furniture.
Tile.Terraria/Workbenches: Station for basic manufacturing, good for basic projects. Can be augmented with a bottle to allow alchemical projects.
Tile.Terraria/Furnace: Contained fire capable of reaching temperatures needed for metalworking.
Tile.Terraria/Anvil: Metal workstation for tool and arms manufacturing.
Tile.Terraria/Loom: Weaving machine capable of working with spider silk.
Tile.Terraria/Sand: Sand of a typical composition. Viable to form into glass.
Tile.Terraria/Bottle: Alchemical grade bottle. Allows creation of potions.
Tile.Terraria/Chairs: Furniture intended for humans to sit on.
Tile.StarlightRiver/AnkhChest: A storage device sealed with a crystaline lock. A starlight-infused dash can shatter it.
Tile.StarlightRiver/AuroraIce: Solidified aurora lights. Capable of harvest with common instruments.
Tile.StarlightRiver/Bouncer: A regenerating crystal which interacts kinetically with starlight-infused dashes.
Tile.StarlightRiver/CrashPod: A metallic container from an unknown cosmic origin. A starlight-infused dash can breach it's hull.
Tile.StarlightRiver/DashBarrier: Weak stone held together with magic. A starlight-infused dash will destroy it effortlessly.
Tile.StarlightRiver/DesertMonolith: Large sandstone monoliths carved with the markings of a subteranian civilization. Indicative of subteranian ruins.
Tile.StarlightRiver/DesertMonolithFlipped: Large sandstone monoliths carved with the markings of a subteranian civilization. Indicative of subteranian ruins.
Tile.StarlightRiver/DisplayCase: Ornamental fixture designed to secure powerful artifacts. A starlight-infused dash can overcome the aracane seal.
Tile.StarlightRiver/HotspringFountain: A source of water with healing properties.
Tile.StarlightRiver/JarTall: A jar containing liquified starlight. A starlight-infused dash can shatter the glass.
Tile.StarlightRiver/Jellyshroom: A species of fungus with a spring-like head. Capable of propeling a human.
Tile.StarlightRiver/LightGoal: Crystal used for focusing light. Pointing concentrated light at this will amplify it enough to melt glass.
Tile.StarlightRiver/MainForge: A ceraming forge designed to work glass using concentrated light. Capable of forging powerful artifacts.
Tile.StarlightRiver/ManabondTile: A magical scroll which can impart the usage of magic to simpler creatures.
Tile.StarlightRiver/MoonstoneOre: Metallic stone of unknown origin. Has luminescent and hallucinogenic properties.
Tile.StarlightRiver/NPCSpawner: Glass device that can manifest constructs. Only activates when danger is nearby.
Tile.StarlightRiver/Reflector: Glass sculpture capable of redirecting light. Rotating this will redirect a beam hitting it.
Tile.StarlightRiver/Touchstone: Magical monolith sculpted out of ice. Glows when containing a guiding light.
Tile.StarlightRiver/VitricBossAltar: Altar to a guardian. If the containing crystal was shattered with a starlight-infused dash, an offering could be made. Guardian will likely be hostile regardless.
Tile.StarlightRiver/VitricOre: Glass crystal made of weapons and tool grade crystal. Can be broken down to usable size with a starlight-infused dash.
Tile.StarlightRiver/VitricOreFloat: Glass crystal made of weapons and tool grade crystal. Can be broken down to usable size with a starlight-infused dash.
Tile.StarlightRiver/VitricSpike: Glass crystal in a dangerous formation. Contact will result in pain.

AirHints.Default: You have encountered a bug. Please report it to the developers.
AirHints.PreGlassweaver: Previous direction indicates you should search below subterranian desert areas.
AirHints.PreWinds: The temple within the vitric desert contains important starlight energies in it's deepest compartment.
AirHints.PreCeiros: An offering of high-grade glass crystal will draw out a guardian on top of the vitric temple. Previous direction indicates you need to destroy this.
AirHints.PostCeiros: Directions complete. You should report back to the ancient glassweaver.
